Description: CPSC imposed a $4 million penalty against Graco Children's Products Inc., of Exton, Pa., for failing to inform the government in a timely manner about more than 12 million products that posed a danger to young children nationwide.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2005/Record-Civil-Penalty-Levied-Against-Graco-Childrens-Products-Inc-CPSC-Graco-announce-new-recall-of-12-million-toddler-beds

Description: Untimely recall in 2014. 49 USC 30118(c)(1) and 30119(c)(2), 49 CFR 573.6(b).
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20150511145448/http://www.nhtsa.gov/About+NHTSA/Press+Releases/2015/Car-seat-maker-Graco-fined-$10-million
https://caselaw.findlaw.com/us-10th-circuit/1278789.html
https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/regulations/enforcement/national-listing-enforcement-cases-subject-name-closed-fiscal-year-2006-pdf
Notes: Year is fiscal year. Date is closing date.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Company: Sunbeam Products, Inc. d/b/a Jarden Consumer Solutions
Description: Sunbeam Products, Inc. d/b/a Jarden Consumer Solutions agreed to pay a $4.5 million civil penalty to settle allegations that the firm knowingly failed to report to CPSC immediately, as required by federal law, that its Mr. Coffee Single Cup Brewing System BVMC-KG1 series coffeemakers were defective and posed an unreasonable risk of serious injury or death to consumers.
Info Source: http://www.cpsc.gov/en/Newsroom/News-Releases/2016/Jarden-Consumer-Solutions-Agrees-to-Pay-45-Million-Civil-Penalty-for-Failure-to-Report-Defective-Single-Cup-Coffeemakers/
